intro: Gompholobium aristatum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth-flowered glory pea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as Western Australia. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, with distinctive spurred petals, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds. It is often used in ecological restoration due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
